data.title: The Best New TV Shows Streaming In August 2024 On Netflix, Hulu And More
data.meta_description: Check out the best new and returning TV shows streaming in August, including new seasons of "Only Murders In The Building," "Emily In Paris," "Industry," and much more.
data.text:
New and returning TV series will be dropping across your favorite streaming platforms in August. Whether you’re in the mood to watch a gripping drama or a binge-worthy comedy, some of the best TV shows are streaming this month on Netflix, Apple TV+, Prime Video, Max, and more.

There are many returning shows in August, including Hulu’s fan-favorite comedy-drama Only Murders In The Building, which is back with its fourth season featuring a new murder mystery to solve. There’s also the third season of Industry, HBO’s fast-paced drama set in the world of London high finance.

ForbesWhat's New On Max In August 2024? 'Industry' Season 3 And More

Netflix subscribers can look forward to the anticipated fourth season of Emily in Paris. Lily Collins returns as marketing executive Emily Cooper. Now, the stylish American must grapple with her strong feelings for Alfie and Gabriel, with the latter expecting a baby with his ex, Camille.

You won’t want to miss new shows like Apple TV+’s new detective drama Bad Monkey, starring Vince Vaughn and Michelle Monaghan. There’s also Netflix’s new murder mystery series, A Good Girl’s Guide To Murder, which arrived on August 1 and is already the streaming giant’s No. 1 TV series in the U.S.

The 8 Best TV Shows Streaming In August 2024

Check out the best new and returning TV shows on streaming platforms in August. Discover some of our top eight, along with their premiere dates and how to watch them.

Only Murders In The Building (Season 4)

Premiere date: August 27, 2024

Where to stream Only Murders In The Building: Hulu

In the fourth season of Only Murders In The Building, the detective trio (Martin Short, Steve Martin, Selena Gomez) will return after the events at the end of Season 3, which revolve around Charles’ stunt double and friend Sazz Pataki.

The Season 4 synopsis reads, “Questioning whether Sazz or Charles was the intended victim, our trio’s investigation leads them all the way to Los Angeles where a Hollywood studio is readying a film about the Only Murders podcast. As our amateur sleuths race back to New York, they embark on an even more epic journey — traversing their building’s courtyard to delve into the twisted lives of the Arconia’s West Tower residents.”

Industry (Season 3)

Premiere date: August 11, 2024

Where to stream Industry: Max

In Industry season three, Yasmin, Robert, and Eric find themselves “front and centre in the splashy IPO of Lumi, a green tech energy company led by Sir Henry Muck,” a new character played by Game of Thrones star Kit Harington.

“Since leaving Pierpoint, Harper is eager to get back into the addictive thrill of finance and finds an unlikely partner in FutureDawn portfolio manager Petra Koenig,” the synopsis continues.

Emily in Paris (Season 4)

Premiere dates: Part 1 on August 15, 2024; Part 2 on September 12, 2024

Where to stream Emily in Paris: Netflix

The first part of Emily in Paris Season 4 returns on August 15, followed by the second part on September 12. The next season picks up after Alfie ends his relationship with Emily. In the finale, Camille also dropped the major bombshell that she was pregnant with Gabriel’s baby.

At work, “Sylvie is forced to confront a thorny dilemma from her past for the sake of her marriage, and the Agence Grateau team navigates personnel shakeups. Mindy and the band prepare for Eurovision, but when funds run dry, they’re forced to get thrifty. Emily and Gabriel’s chemistry is undeniable as they work together towards a Michelin star, but two big secrets threaten to undo everything they’ve dreamed of,” the synopsis reads.

Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power (Season 2)

Premiere date: August 29, 2024

Where to stream Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power: Prime Video

In the second season of The Rings of Power on Prime Video, the rising Dark Lord Sauron is back. He must now rebuild his strength and oversee the creation of the Rings of Power, which will grant him the ability to bind all the peoples of Middle-earth to his “sinister will.”

Season two promises to plunge "even its most beloved and vulnerable characters into a rising tide of darkness, challenging each to find their place in a world that is increasingly on the brink of calamity,” according to the official synopsis. “Elves and dwarves, orcs and men, wizards and Harfoots… as friendships are strained and kingdoms begin to fracture, the forces of good will struggle ever more valiantly to hold on to what matters to them most of all… each other.”

Bad Monkey (Season 1)

Premiere date: August 14

Where to stream Bad Monkey: Apple TV+

Bad Monkey is Apple TV+’s new original drama series premiering on August 14. The show stars Vince Vaughn, Michelle Monaghan, Jodie Turner-Smith, Meredith Hagner, and more.

The series tells the story of Andrew Yancy (Vince Vaughn), a former police detective “who been bounced from the Miami Police Department and is now a health inspector in the Keys,” according to the synopsis. “But after stumbling upon a case that begins with a human arm fished up by tourists, he realizes that if he can prove murder, he’ll be back in. He just needs to get past a trove of Floridian oddballs and one bad monkey.”

The Umbrella Academy (Season 4)

Premiere date: August 8, 2024

Where to stream The Umbrella Academy: Netflix

The fourth and final season of The Umbrella Academy will debut on Netflix on August 8. Based on the comic series of the same name, the series follows estranged siblings with superpowers who come together after their father’s death.

Season 4 will continue after last season’s huge twist. “There’s a new timeline dictated by the family patriarch, Reginald (Colm Feore), and the siblings no longer have their powers. That’s not the only oddity in this timeline, where the stakes are higher than ever before — there are new enemies who want to see them wiped from existence, but how do they face their enemies without their powers? And will the siblings ever get them back?” Netflix’s Tudum writes.

Pachinko (Season 2)

Premiere date: August 23, 2024

Where to stream Pachinko: Apple TV+

Another returning series from AppleTV+ is the second season of Pachinko, a Korean drama based on Min Jin Lee’s bestselling 2017 novel. The show follows four generations of a Korean family who moved to Japan before the start of World War II.

According to the official synopsis for Season 2, “the parallel stories pick up in Osaka in 1945, where Sunja is forced to make dangerous decisions for her family’s survival during World War II, and in Tokyo in 1989, which finds Solomon exploring new, humble beginnings.”

A Good Girl’s Guide To Murder (Season 1)

Premiere date: August 1, 2024

Where to stream A Good Girl’s Guide To Murder: Netflix

Starring Wednesday actress Emma Myers, A Good Girl’s Guide to Murder is the BBC and Netflix’s new murder mystery series based on Holly Jackson’s bestselling mystery trilogy.

The series takes place five years after the alleged murder of high school student Andie Bell. The police closed the case after her boyfriend, Sal Singh, committed suicide after her suspected death. But 17-year-old amateur sleuth Pip doesn’t believe someone like Sal could kill anyone. She teams up with Sal’s brother, Ravi, to prove his innocence for a school project, which turns into an obsession she can’t shake off.
